name: 尹秦清
objective:
This course introduces the basic concepts, current development and practical operation of e-commerce from the perspectives of business and technology. Through case discussion, this course will discuss the implementation and management of e-commerce, such as website design, internet marketing, social networking sites, and business practice. This course will enhance the abilities of the students in e-commerce research and practical operation. The course content includes: 
1. Introduction of e-commerce
2. Internet business model and strategy
3. Internet marketing and online business operation
schedule:
Week 1: Course Introduction
Week 2: Introduction of E-commerce
Week 2: Infrastructure of E-commerce I
Week 3: Infrastructure of E-commerce II
Week 4: Internet and Mobile Platform 
Week 5: Business Model of E-commerce I
Week 6: Business Model of E-commerce II
Week 7: Online Retail and Services I
Week 8: Online Retail and Services II
Week 9: Midterm Exam
Week 10: Internet Consumer Behavior I
Week 11: Internet Consumer Behavior II
Week 12: Internet Marketing Mix: Product
Week 13: Internet Marketing Mix: Pricing
Week 14: Internet Marketing Mix: Channel
Week 15: Internet Marketing Mix: Promotion
Week 16: Application of Personal E-commerce 
Week 17: Final Report (PPT presentation)
Week 18: Holiday for Dragon Boat Festival
scorePolicy:
1. Attendance & Class Participation: 20% 
2. Case Study Presentation: 20%
3. Midterm Exam: 30%
4. Final Report: 30%
materials: 1. Laudon, K. C. & Traver, C. G. E-Commerce 2021-2022: Business, Technology, Society, 17th Edition (2021). Pearson press.
